level.heading: Void marriage or domestic partnership.
level.text: If a marriage or domestic partnership is determined to be void, an agreement that would otherwise have been a premarital agreement is enforceable only to the extent necessary to avoid an inequitable result, unless the agreement expressly provides that it shall be enforceable in the event that the marriage or domestic partnership is later determined to be void.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-79, in section heading, substituted "marriage or domestic partnership" for "marriage"; and substituted "marriage or domestic partnership" for "marriage".

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-82, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-501.

level.heading: Uniform Law
level.text: This section is based upon § 7 of the Uniform Premarital Agreement Act. See 9C Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.
